Description:
An Entertainers Delight
This inviting elevated home offers comfort, space and easy indoor/outdoor living on a landscaped allotment. The light and roomy interior comprises of three robed bedrooms, a large functional bathroom, a modern contemporary lounge, a dining area and a practical kitchen with stainless-steel appliances.
Designed a double garage and workshop space at ground level, this brick veneer home offers a lovely elevated floorplan (with external sunblinds to the West), while a further double length carport (behind gates) is available to the side, which allows for extra vehicles or a caravan to be parked with complete safety.
The lounge is carefully considered with allergy free floating floors with sliding doors accessing the front balcony for additional views across the town. A freestanding combustion heater keeps the home toasty and warm, while a gas heater, ceiling fan plus a split system ensure the overall temperature is comfortable all year round. The family bathroom boasts large proportions with extra fittings allowing access for a wheelchair, while also providing plenty of room to manoeuvre comfortably throughout the zone.
An additional living area is designed perfectly for a children's play room or games area with double aspect windows taking in the views of the rear deck and landscaped garden beyond. Beautifully tiered with an ornamental pond, this majestic garden can be viewed from the fully covered deck which is perfect for further dining outdoors or just relaxing.
For those who work from home, you are offered a downstairs home office or teenage retreat with an additional storage room and added benefit of a second entry from the downstairs garage.
This 850m2 allotment with town water is positioned along a service road off Clunes Road, where a wide reserve and school bus pick is available for educational options within Ballarat. Shops, eateries and recreational facilities are just minutes away, which is ideal for retirees to take a stroll or lifestyle devotees.
Call our agent for further details and inspection times.
Insights: 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
A Wondrous Leafy Outlook in the Heart of Town
This wonderful home is as beautiful as it has been cherished. With just the one family enjoying its splendour the abode offers comfort, convenience and privacy. Built in 1983 the residence chases the morning sunshine while granting views but over trees and greenery. There are two large bedrooms taking your larger suites and a smaller bedroom or optional office. A large lounge takes in the highset views and its vast proportions will please. The dining area is open plan to a very functional kitchen. A split system provides all year comfort for the occupant and convenience of being the shortest of strolls to schooling, shopping and fabulous coffee will delight guests. Pretty gardens and two balconies to enjoy either your morning or afternoon cuppa have you enjoying the true warmth of the home.

Description:
VACANT LAND IN THIS MUCH SOUGHT-AFTER LOCATION
When there is such a demand for vacant land, you don’t want to miss the opportunity to purchase 26.24 acres (10.62ha) which is zoned FZ (Farm Zone) in this sought-after location: Bald Hills.
Located just 20 minutes from Ballarat on the Addington-Creswick Road with Bitumen road frontage to the block and Power nearby, this property boasts great potential to make a profit for someone who is willing to put in the work to tidy this block up.
Contact the agent for more information.
Don’t miss out.

Description:
Freehold with Shop & Residencet
Don't miss this opportunity to place yourself right in the centre of the main shopping strip of Creswick. This ideal location offers commercial space which is currently set up as a hairdressing salon and separately metered to the 3 bedroom residence at rear. Allows for work from home or as investment (residence currently leased to October 2018 at $220p/w). Good size shedding with access to wood shed from the rear. Enclosed yard with easy care garden and off road parking for residence.
For more information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
LIGHTLY -TREED BLOCK ON THE EDGE OF DAYLESFORD
This is your opportunity to purchase this 3.58 ha [ 8.9 acres] approx. lightly-treed block in this very tightly held location. The property is in Hepburn Shire – Rural Living Zone. All the hard work has been done with a site excavated for a residence, steel shed with concrete floor and small tank. The electricity has been connected. An ideal site for you to build country home, weekend retreat [STCA] or getaway glamping bush block.
*3.58 ha Rural living
*Lightly treed with a dam
*Steel shed with concrete floor and tank
*Electricity connected
*Fully fenced
An inspection is highly recommended.

Description:
Vacant Block Awaits Your House Plans
This attractive allotment simply awaits your dream home. The block measures 461m2 and has a great frontage of 20m which will assist in fitting a larger variety of house plans. The depth is 23m and allows for yard space, shedding or an outdoor entertaining area. The land is in a quiet street and only two minutes to the hub of town and a 30 second walk to local landmark "Flemo's". Water, storm water and sewer are to the block as is power to the front of the property. NBN wiring is also to the land.

Address: CA 16, S 47 Lewers Street Creswick VIC 3363
Description:
Prime Development Opportunity
Perfectly positioned at the northern end of Lewers Street, with quality established homes surrounding and just a short stroll to Shops, Schools and transport is this prime residential development opportunity on approx. 3370m2. Situated in the highly sort after and historic town of Creswick in the Hepburn Shire, this fantastic parcel of land is Zoned General Residential (GRZ1) and is an ideal subdivision opportunity with the potential for multiple residential allotments(STCA).
With limited quality land parcels left available in the area and a 15 minute commute to Central Ballarat and easy connection with the Western Freeway to Melbourne this makes for a fantastic opportunity.
All services are readily available to the property with ample frontage to Lewers Street from the western boundary.
Please note this is a Public Auction of Crown Land on behalf of the Department of Treasury and Finance, and there will be no stamp duty payable on this sale. GST (10%) will be payable on top of the purchase price.
Crown Land does not require a Section 32 (Vendors Statement) although further information regarding the property and its zoning and other information can be obtained from the Selling Agents.

Description:
LAND, Beautiful Half Acre Building Block.
This half acre, gently sloping block of land with northerly aspect is situated on the high side of the road in the township of Creswick, it is in a sheltered position and the block is connected with town water, power, sewerage, NBN etc, and is nicely placed among quality homes. The block is a very short walk to the RACV Goldfields Resort and championship golf course. The township of Creswick offers a rail service to Melbourne, a shuttlebus service to Tullarmarine airport (from the RACV resort)
and is just 13 kilometres from Ballarat, and a short drive to Daylesford.

Description:
The Sweetest of Homes, The Loveliest of Gardens!
This delightful home is set on the Ballarat side of town. The pretty abode is bounded by lush gardens, some of which are edible, all offering wondrous outlooks. The young residence is both warm and comfy. The bedrooms take the larger suites, while the living area is open plan to the dining and kitchen. An enclosed porch area is an ideal study or a wonderful place for your morning coffee. The hub of town is the shortest of strolls away to visit your favourite café, shops, real estate agent, restaurants or to buy a paper. A low maintenance property, just move in and enjoy the lifestyle.

Description:
Original Miners Cottage
Offered for sale is this quaint original Miner's Cottage on approximately 760m2 of flat land, located only two minutes drive from the bustling hub of Creswick.
With three good sized bedrooms and a central family room with cosy wood heater, this home is ripe for renovation for the astute investor as original homes are much sought after in the area.
The kitchen is spacious with an adjacent dining area and the bathroom also houses the laundry facilities, making cleaning a breeze.
A single lock up garage will house your vehicle and the block size means that an investor may wish to subdivide STCA. With a new home recently erected next door and many new homes around the corner, the area is moving ahead at a steady rate. Get in early and make a killing on this little nugget.
Creswick is growing at a phenomenal rate, with many cafes, French patisserie, Supermarket, Doctors, chemist, clothing store, vets and many more. Public transport is a breeze with buses down the main St into Ballarat and trains morning and night as well as many community groups and activities available. 3 Primary schools, kinder, childcare and children's sports groups round off the family side of things.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Description:
Throw away the hustle and bustle of city life & escape to your Country Paradise at the Romantic Vineyard comprising main house & cottage.
Located at the Pyrenees Wine Region in central Victoria, the Romantic Vineyard is well removed from the hustle and bustle of the busy city life.
It has a generous land size of approximately 19 acres with 4 acres (approx.) of grape vines and features a main house that consists of 3 bedrooms, an office which can be converted as the 4th bedroom, 2 bathrooms, a commercial kitchen with a café style dining room, lovely balcony with serene vineyard views and a covered entertainment area. Separate Cottage with bathroom for guests, four car garage and workshop, 2 large dams and a bore license.
Extra features include underground wine cellar, an established orchard, water tanks, solar panels, furniture, equipment... the list goes on and on.
With fabulous views surrounding the house/cottage, native birds and animals visits during the year, stars filled sky at night, this is your peaceful country paradise to enjoy life.
This delightful lifestyle property is being offered for sale as a main house, a guest cottage and 19 acres of fabulous land including various shedding at the same time offering the purchaser potential to earn an income from bed and breakfast / restaurant / cafe / wine sales etc. if desired.
Location Information:
---------------------------------
Just ten minutes to Talbot. Twenty minutes to Avoca and Maryborough. 45 minutes to Ballarat or Bendigo, and approximately 2 hours from Melbourne

Description:
Kangaroo Hill Farm House on 74 acres
Located just 15 minutes to Daylesford with productive red soil and an abundance of water this property has a lot to offer! The comfortable 2-bedroom home feature bright and light living space with long views to Mt Franklin & Mt Kooroocheang, central kitchen with dishwasher, covered entertaining decking and fully fenced backyard. The infrastructure has been set up with horses in mind with a country style open barn with 2 stables, horse holding yards, Colorbond roller door garage with tack room, storage shed and 2 x carports. Currently divided into two paddocks with stock troughs in each paddock (fed by bore water).
-Corner block of 74.28 acres (30.06ha) land size Zoned Farming (entrance from Judson’s lane)
-Bore water, mains power, septic system, telephone line, dam of approx. 1-acre
-Split system heating/cooling & Fan forced wood heater
-Close by to Captains Creek Organic Winery & Swiss Mountain Hotel
Inspections by private appointment and are highly recommended.

Description:
Family home or new investment
This solid brick veneer 3 bedroom family home is set on approx.. 3,177 sqm with a large front garden with mature low maintenance plants, plenty of shade trees and heaps of room for the kids to explore whilst you watch over them from the comfort of the full length front veranda. The home is on a corner location and encased in a mature screening hedge for your privacy and enjoyment. The rear of the property has a large undercover entertainment pergola, two double car garages and a fully lined one room studio, perfect for the home office or play room for the kids, a secure area for a chook or dog run and complete with a veggie garden.
Inside the home it is in good condition, the kitchen has been modernised and neutralised with its black and white colour scheme and vinyl wrap kitchen cupboards, loads of bench space, room for a dining setting, updated timber look flooring through the kitchen, entry and dining rooms. The lounge has a central woodfire, a family bathroom with separate bath and shower and all 3 bedrooms contained at one of the home together.
This home is in a prime location in Newlyn, just 10 minutes from Daylesford, 5 minutes to Creswick and around 25 mins to Ballarat, it is currently tenanted and it will suit those seeking their private country home, weekender or continue as a rental investment.
Call today for an inspection.

Address: 298 Langdons Hill Rd Langdons Hill VIC 3363
Description:
Dual Occupancy- 20 Minutes from Daylesford
Located on a sealed road on approximately 2.74 Fertile Hectares (6.7 Acres) this property has a 5 Bed room, 2 Bathroom, 2 Kitchen dual occupancy home erected on it. The East wing has 2 Bedrooms a renovated Ensuite and kitchen/meals/lounge. Off the entry the West wing has 3 Bed rooms, kitchen, lounge and dining area and Bathroom, yet to be renovated. The home has been re-clad with maintenance free Colorbond steel cladding ( WOW !! no more painting ) .The land is red volcanic loam and is fenced into 4 main paddocks with electric fencing .The large dam plus a fresh water bore ( potable ) gives you all the water you will ever need for livestock gardens and domestic use.The two lock up sheds have multiple uses together with a dog run ,chook house and fruit trees .
The property could be used for two family accommodation or as an income stream via air B & B or Farm Holiday stay accommodation as it is only 20 mins from the Tourist hub of Daylesford and 5 mins from the renowned Swiss Mountain Hotel on Midland Highway at Blampied.
For Horse Endurance enthusiasts or Trail Bike riders the Wombat forest is just down the road. The Bendigo to Ballarat Goldfields track is only 3 kms to the East. The opportunity this property offers is only limited by your imagination. The views of Langdon Hill are everchanging which adds to the properties atmosphere and appeal.

Description:
Country Oasis of 26 Acres on the Outskirts of Town
This splendid property grants the occupier the lifestyle you have been seeking. The picturesque views don't just stop at the properties borders but stretch on for miles. The home has a wondrous country comfy feel with great proportions and wondrous outlooks from every window. A stunning kitchen makes entertaining a breeze and is open plan to the dining and then flows to the living room or out to the outdoor area. There is amazing car coverage and shedding with four car carport and American barn. There is 66,000 litres of water tank and animal shelters and yards. Fencing throughout the property is great order and there are two road accesses granting convenience. All this just minute out of town. What more could you desire.

Description:
COUNTRY COTTAGE IN POPULAR TALBOT
Set in popular Talbot is this old world cottage with two bedrooms on a large allotment. The traditional layout compliments the era of this gem, step in the front door to the lounge room that then follow through to the kitchen dining room. There is a working kitchen wood burner, complimented by a gas freestanding stove and plenty of space for dining. This follows through to a sun room at the rear of the home that is light and bright with access to the yard. In addition to the two bedrooms there is a third storage room or perhaps a study.
Outdoors there is a plethora of shedding, larger barn style shed with mezzanine level, workshop, wood storage, water tank, chook pens with the advantage of mains power and water. Here is your opportunity to enjoy the country life.
Contact LUKE WILLIAMS on 0415 104 044 at our Maryborough office to book your inspection today

Description:
Ideally Located Close to Schools, Shopping and Bus
Located on the Ballarat side of Creswick, this charming home awaits a new family. Offering 3 bedrooms and a large living area, it is kept comfortable all year round with both ducted heating and evaporative cooling, with the addition of 3KW of solar to keep those bills low. The Master bedroom would easily accommodate a king sized suite, with the added benefit of a large walk-in-robe and well-appointed ensuite. The 2nd and 3rd bedrooms have built-in-robes and are both close to the family bathroom. A study has been cleverly hidden away in a large cupboard with NBN connected. Being that it is a stones' throw from public transport, walking distance to the bustling township centre and primary schools, this home would suit families or retirees alike and is on a compact low maintenance block of approximately 544m2. A vegetable garden has been added near the large entertainment deck, and all this backs onto crown land to the rear, which is teaming with birds and wildlife. The statuesque gums offer a peaceful backdrop from the deck. Call our agent today for an inspection.

Description:
Functional, spacious, peaceful
On a large block in a very well-established part of Creswick stands this magnificent 4 bedroom family-friendly home and it is now waiting for a new owner.
From such a beautiful street-scape, the welcoming front entrance brings you into the lounge room, study, through to the living room at the rear of the home - or it could direct you to the privacy of the bedrooms upstairs; either way, it’s a functional hub of the home and fills with intrigue at what comes next!
The open kitchen, living, dining area has beautiful views across the decking into the yard below, while adjacent to this living space is a large laundry with extra shower and toilet.
NBN is connected to the home via fibre (FTPP), which ensures a faster and more reliable service; certainly making working from home a worthy option.
Another surprise element to the home is the particularly spacious and secluded family/rumpus room at the front of the home. Complete with gas log fire, carpeted floors and a homely ambience, this area will be a real plus for the growing family.
The home captures the morning sun through its large east-facing windows which raises not only the winter temperature but also increases the ambient light throughout the home.
Only one street back from the main CBD of Creswick, the home retains a peaceful ambience and makes an ideal residence for the family seeking to upgrade or live the peaceful life in a beautiful regional Victorian town, so we encourage your early inspection of this stand out property.

Description:
Options of Lifestyle or Development in Central Position
This wonderful home is set in a quiet locale just 30 seconds to the hub of town. It also delivers a dramatic parcel of land measuring 3407m2. This attractive allotment grants the family room for fun & games, extensions, further shedding, birdlife and more. The potential developer could consider other avenues (STCA) with a frontage of 59 meters and a second street access. There are lovely views to be had from the property and with the home being set back from the street, a great sense of privacy is had. The abode has a wondrous feel of warmth. Timber features throughout and combustion heating certainly add to the ambiance. All room sizes throughout are very generous taking large suites and the two living rooms can host many guests. These lead out to a vast outdoor entertaining area.
